tutorCourseDashboardButton.headline: Tutor Course Dashboard
tutorCourseDashboardButton.content: If you navigate to the <tt>Tutor Course Dashboard</tt> you will be able to get an overview of several student submissions and grade them.

overview.headline: Overview
overview.content: Here you can see the statistics of your <tt>assessments</tt> and received <tt>complaints</tt> and <tt>feedback requests</tt> about your assessments.

showFinished.headline: Show Finished Exercises
showFinished.content: Finished exercises are not displayed in the exercise table. In order to see all exercises, including the finished ones, just have tick the checkbox <tt>Show finished exercises</tt>.

exerciseTable.headline: Exercise Table
exerciseTable.content: This table displays all exercises of this course, including their <tt>exercise type</tt>, <tt>exercise title</tt>, the <tt>status</tt> of the grading process and the exercise and assessment <tt>due dates</tt>.

gradingProcess.headline: Grading Process
gradingProcess.content:
This graph visualizes your current grading process and marks the nodes in green, if the underlying process steps are finished:
  1. Read the grading instructions
  2. Train on the example submissions (if available)
  3. Assess student submissions
  4. Evaluate students' complaints and feedback requests

exerciseDashboardButton.headline: Exercise Dashboard
exerciseDashboardButton.content: Let's head over to the exercise dashboard to view the exercise details and student submissions.

instructions.headline: Instructions
instructions.content: This section contains the <tt>Problem statement</tt>, <tt>Example solution</tt> and <tt>Grading instructions</tt> of the exercise. Please read through them carefully and then proceed to the next step.

instructionsButton.headline: Confirm instructions
instructionsButton.content: Click on this button and confirm only after you have read and understood the instructions.

reviewExampleSubmission.headline: Review Example Submission
reviewExampleSubmission.content: Click here to see how a text submission and its assessment could look like.

assessExampleSubmission.headline: Assess Example Submission
assessExampleSubmission.content: Click here to work on your first assessment for a text exercise.

submissionsAndComplaints.headline: Student submission
submissionsAndComplaints.content: The student submissions that have to be assessed will be displayed here after the exercise due date.

assessSubmissions.headline: Assess Student Submissions
assessSubmissions.content: To start an actual assessment you need to click on the button <tt>Start new assessment</tt>. In this case the button is disabled for tutorial reasons.

reviewSubmission.headline: Review Example Submission
reviewSubmission.content: This is an example submission where three text blocks are already marked for assessment.

reviewAssessment.headline: Review Example Assessment
reviewAssessment.content: This is an example assessment of the submission. Each text block is graded with the score 1.

confirm.headline: Confirm
confirm.content: Confirm only after you have read and understood the example.

addAssessment.headline: Assess Example Submission
addAssessment.content: Now you can start assessing this text exercise.
addAssessment.task: Mark the text of one software pattern and click on the <tt>Assess</tt> button. Do the same for the remaining two patterns. In the end you should have three highlighted text blocks.

addScore.headline: Add Score
addScore.content: Here you can add a score and additional feedback for each assessment element.
addScore.task: Add the score '1' for each assessment element.

submit.headline: Submit Assessment
submit.content: Now you can submit your assessment.

back.headline: Complete Assessment Tour
back.content: Navigate back to the exercise dashboard to complete your tour.
